data.title: News and communications
data.meta_description: Find news and communications from government
data.text:
It is the first case detected in the 2024/25 vector season - a 20km temporary control zone has been put in place around the affected farm.

Updated: 26 August 2024

Ambassador Holland marks Ukraine's Independence Day and condemns Russia's efforts to eradicate Ukrainian identity through its illegal war of aggression.

Updated: 26 August 2024

Dozens of UK tourist hotspots to get faster, more reliable mobile coverage across the Great British countryside this bank holiday.

Updated: 26 August 2024

UK government’s prestigious Chevening Scholarships applications for next cohort (2025/26) open until 5 November 2024.

Updated: 26 August 2024

Prime Minister Keir Starmer's letter to ParalympicsGB ahead of Paralympic Games in Paris.

Updated: 25 August 2024

Dr Jennifer Hoyle, Lesley Francois and Daniel Shears have been reappointed to the Industrial Injuries Advisory Council from 1 September 2024.

Updated: 23 August 2024

Government Campus delivers a programme of learning to support new government ministers.

Updated: 23 August 2024

This follows investigations into the companies by the Insolvency Service

Updated: 23 August 2024

The Government has made the regulations to establish the Infected Blood Compensation Scheme.

Updated: 23 August 2024

A violent thug who permanently blinded his victim in one eye after he threw a corrosive substance in his face has had his sentence increased.

Updated: 23 August 2024

This is an exciting opportunity to join the Office for Place in Stoke-on-Trent, a new arms-length body to MHCLG. The Office for Place will lead and shape the work that will enable it to support councils and communities to cr…

Updated: 23 August 2024

Home Office senior investigating officer Richard Murray explains why he recommends Foundations of writing in government (JASPER) course.

Updated: 23 August 2024

The Prime Minister spoke to President Xi Jinping of China this morning.

Updated: 23 August 2024

Members of a people-smuggling ring have been jailed yesterday after being caught cramming 2 Afghan migrants into a tiny car boot.

Updated: 23 August 2024

Devon-based businessman is subject to 13 years of sanctions after abusing the Bounce Back Loan scheme five times during the Covid pandemic

Updated: 23 August 2024

A door supervisor who worked at a bar in Garforth without a licence has been convicted at Kirklees Magistrates’ Court.

Updated: 23 August 2024

British High Commissioner Neil Wigan pays first visit to Wajir County to discuss partnership and the impact of UK programming in the county.

Updated: 23 August 2024

The Trade Remedies Authority has initiated a transition review into an anti-dumping measure on bicycles and certain bicycle parts from China.

Updated: 23 August 2024

Father and daughter who applied for five Covid Bounce Back Loans between them handed suspended sentences for fraud

Updated: 23 August 2024
